summary: John L. Hart is identified as the likely author of the "Hart Report," a document of interest to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The HSCA requested access to this report, suggesting its relevance to the assassination inquiry. While the specific contents of the Hart Report are not detailed, its significance is indicated by the attention it received in relation to the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act and concerns surrounding the CIA's handling of information, particularly in connection to the Yuriy Nosenko case.
